title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Been buying this eyeliner since the early 2000's.
content: It used to be called "Amazing i-Liner". I've tried other eyeliners over the years in a genuine effort to move on from this product, but they don't seem to do it for me like this does. I do believe the formula has changed, as it does take reapplication of the eyeliner to get an opaque look. While it's labeled hypoallergenic and no doubt it is, I notice fresh bottles tend to sting but leave no irritation on the skin. The applicator tip also is pretty stiff at first but once you break it in — it does work beautifully. Here's why I've kept buying this eyeliner for over 20 years: 1. A true matte finish. I've purchased  "matte" eyeliners that have end up having a semi-gloss finish, or a weird sticky flakey texture. My theory is because these products attempt to waterproof the formula which sacrifice that flat matte finish. While unfortunately this Almay eyeliner isn't waterproof and therefore not smudgeproof — there's nothing a little finishing spray or eyeshadow primer can't do. I've used both with great results during swimming and gym workouts. In my opinion, I love the true matte black and don't mind it doesn't have those other properties built into to it. 2. A fantastic felt tip applicator. Something about the shape, material, length, and absorbency of this applicator works perfectly for my hooded eyelids. There are $20+ high-end eyeliners that just don't get right what this $7 drugstore eyeliner can do. Some felt tips are too long and therefore hard to control, some are a thin brush which doesn't hold as much product in one swipe. If you want to avoid breaking in the felt tip and the roughness that comes at first, I recommend just squeezing the felt tip between your fingers and gently bend it around to soften it a bit more. 3. A long-lasting amount of product. You'd be surprised how long that little "ink well" of eyeliner can last you! Usually the felt tip applicator is the first to go (after a long while of usage) before you actually run out of product. I like that Almay has kept this element of their eyeliner consistent over the years. Those are my 2 cents. Definitely will continue to buy this for years to come. :) Read more

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best natural looking eyeshadow ever
content: I am nearing 40 and the skin around my eyes is not nearly as tight or firm anymore. I have a lot more creases and my eyelids look noticeably more hooded than when I was younger. I really feel like the natural colors and shading from this palette make my eyes look more youthful and brighter (comparison photos attached of me with no eye makeup vs using this eyeshadow and some mascara). These are truly matte and create flattering, natural shadows of color even when you're over 24.  I've been using it for a couple months now and it never settles in fine lines or creases and I never felt like it makes me look older than I am (which pretty much every other eyeshadow has made me feel). I am not an expert at makeup by any means, nor do I have the time or desire to watch makeup tutorials so I just completely wing it. The brushes on my photo are placed over the colors I use for my "natural" look (the lighter brown for eyeshadow and liner on my bottom lashes and the darker brown for eyeliner on my top lid). These initially go on super light, even on my pale skin, but you can very easily build up the color with another pass of your brush to meet your desired hue. You could make these more bold than what I’ve shown, just by adding a couple more swipes of powder if you wanted to. It is also easy to wipe off, which is great for me since I often mess up - but not great for you if you’re someone who frequently rubs your eyes or something like that. It does have decent staying power, but about halfway through the day I notice it fading away. However, when I say fading away that’s really what I mean. It does not start to fall into creases or flake or anything like that. It just starts to disappear. Every other eyeshadow I’ve tried also doesn’t last all day, but it looks worse and worse as the day goes on. This still looks good even as it starts to fade. I don’t like to spend much time on my makeup, but I think my eyes are my best feature and I like to draw a little attention to them for a little confidence boost. After a bit of practice, it now only takes me a few minutes to swipe this on along with my favorite brown mascara (also in the photo) to enhance my eyes and it’s time well spent in my book. This powder really is perfect for my wants and I’m so happy I found it! I absolutely would recommend it. Hope this helps you decide if this product might work for you too! Read more

The color payoff is decent; it delivers a rich hue that doesn’t fade quickly and provides that perfect pop of color to brighten up any look. The texture is another highlight. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great
content: The COLORGRAM Fruity Glass Gloss in 01 Grape Black is an interesting take on lip gloss for those looking to add a unique, glass-like shine to their makeup routine. The gloss delivers a non-sticky, smooth finish, making it comfortable to wear without that heavy or sticky feeling that many lip glosses can have. The "Grape Black" shade offers a subtle tint that enhances your natural lip color with a cool, dark, and slightly purple undertone, perfect for adding a touch of drama or sophistication to your look. One of the standout features is the hydrating formula. This gloss keeps your lips feeling moisturized and smooth for hours, which is a bonus if you tend to experience dryness. The long-lasting effect ensures that you don’t need to constantly reapply, and the glossy, glass-like finish stays vibrant throughout the day. However, the "Grape Black" shade, while unique, might not be for everyone. The color payoff is semi-sheer, so if you’re looking for something bold, you may need to layer it over a darker lipstick to achieve a more intense look. Additionally, because it’s a gloss, it may need a touch-up after meals or extended wear. Overall, the COLORGRAM Fruity Glass Gloss 01 Grape Black is a great pick for those who love non-sticky, glossy finishes with a subtle, chic tint. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Skincare Staple For a Reason
content: I keep coming back to this unassuming cleanser every time my skin gets the winter blues. For reference: I have oily, combination, with dry patches (overusing tretinoin 0.1) skin and I love heavy skincare during cold days that you can actually feel on your skin like a fuzzy blanket vs the jelly texture creams that soak into my skin and don’t add extra moisture and protection to the dermis. So I use Embryolisse lait crème concentre and about 3 years ago tried this cleanser as I felt that skin was getting more mature (32) and less oily, add all the torture and assault I’ve put it through the years of peelings, scrubs, masks, questionable treatments and recently tretinoin, so I started switching to gentler products, taking a page from French skincare routine, the gentler and simpler—the better. I randomly picked this cleanser because it’s one of the top dermatologist-recommended cleansers for sensitive skin. I tried it for a few days and I HATED it, it has no suds, no lather, no squeaky feeling. So I did with it what I did with other hated products—I put it onto the corner of my bathtub, behind the shower curtain, where all of my unused or hated product went, before eventually, going into the trash can. But, after a year or so I decided to give it another try after seeing the outpouring love for the product from YouTube derms. And I decided to actually give it a try. Because you know, your skin goes through cycles and every cycle (skin cell turnover) is about 3 weeks, so when starting a new product give it a few weeks to work unless you have allergic reaction, you should stop immediately. After trying a few weeks I loved it, my skin got used to it and while using tretinoin and light peeling treatments my skin never felt better. It would get very oily at first but my glands eventually adjusted and produced less sebum. My skin felt so clean and soft, no need to jump out of shower to slab cream on my face before it fully dries and feels like Sahara Desert. It really adds that extra layer of moisture and protection to your skin that I know my skin can use during the colder months. I never had any breakouts while using it or irritations. It soothes my tret abused skin and heals it overnight. The only thing about this product you should remember, it doesn’t remove makeup, I use doable-cleansing always so it doesn’t bother me. I usually use a cleansing oil, then wash it off, pat a little dry so I can work this cleansing cream throughly and it feels heavenly. I’m used to it now not lathering and I’m fine with it. You can massage you face while you’re cleaning it and give yourself a mini spa treatment, it’s worthwhile and never will irritate your skin. I’m a convert believer! Read more

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good for my texture, mildly volumizing
content: The media could not be loaded. This mousse is practically unscented. Apparently, the formula contains all natural ingredients "all grown in the rain forest", not sure how would that be related to the effectiveness or quality of it... I love that it comes in a glass bottle and I can see the content, and the dispenser pump works ok. For a palm full dose I would need like 4 to 5 pumps, because the foam is not very thick. However, this product is not sticky at all, and it is super easy to spread. Since the instructions for this product are so laconic, I decided to try it in two different ways: for a natural air dry look, and for a bouncy blowout. Keep in mind, I have no idea about what level of hold is expected for the volume, and even less info about heat protection. Note: mine is long, medium coarse/wavy hair. Here's what I did: For the air dry look: used in combination with a spray leave-in conditioner only, I wanted to keep it as lightweight as possible. Results: I noticed that the mousse enhanced my natural wavy texture and left no residual stickiness. My hair was as soft as if I hadn't used anything on it. But, on the other hand, it didn't make any difference at all on the volume, and I saw no effect on the shine or frizz. I concluded that this is not my best choice for my natural look. For the blowout look: I used it in combination with a leave-in conditioner (this time I used one with UV and Heat protection) and a blowout cream. My tool: I chose a 2in1 volumizer hot air brush. Results: there was a mild increased volume towards the front and crown sections, barely noticeable today, after 24 hours post styling. Again, not much difference in the shine, compared to not using the mousse. I am sure my results could be affected by my technique and the weight of my very long hair. Maybe I could have seen more texture if I used a diffuser for curls; or maybe I should try this product with traditional rollers. Perhaps this lightweight formula will be better for people with very thin or short hair. I hope my experiment helps others as reference. Read more

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works well for plaque psoriasis / dandruff
content: Background: I've had plaque psoriasis for years. Years of extreme itchiness, large dandruff flakes and plaque buildup around the hairline, and waking up several times each night to violently scratch my head.  I primarily used the MG217 coal tar shampoo, which works well enough but smells horrible and leaves the hair feeling very dry. I recently switched to the Surface healthy scalp shampoo (only the shampoo, not the whole 3-step system Surface recommends). I was very skeptical, as the claims all read like woo-woo pseudoscience. HOWEVER, I've been using it for about 2 weeks now and have been very pleased with the results. It has been a gradual but noticeable improvement. My scalp is significantly less itchy than it has been in months, the plaque buildup is nearly gone, and I only notice flakes when using a fine-tooth comb with a decent amount of pressure on the scalp. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Non-sticky, non-oily, absorbent - Scented - I like it
content: The description of the product sounds great and trustworthy. It offers intensive care for hands that are frequently washed, sanitized, or irritated. My hands feel soft with minimal shine. Scent is subtle on my skin. It smells fresh/clean and a little floral. It has a lightweight, lotion consistency. The formula is absorbent, non-sticky, non-oily, and non-irritating. It offers a lot of positives. (2) Why is it so expensive, $30? Because it’s imported from the Netherlands? (3) While I do like the scent, I don’t think fragrance should be added to products made for irritated hands. After saying all of that, I still think it is a nice hand (or body) moisturizer that I’ll happily use. I’ll be using this mainly as a preventative since my hands aren’t currently in need of repair. I should also add that I am prone to wrist rashes and this did not cause a flare up. -Ingredients: aqua, ethylhexyl stearate, cetearyl alcohol, cyclopentasiloxane, tocopheryl acetate, glycerin, dimethicone, cyclohexasiloxane, butyrospermum parkii butter, octyldodecanol, cetearyl glucoside, mel, ribes nigrum seed oil, bisabolol, allantoin, helianthus annuus seed oil, helianthus annuus seed oil unsaponifiables, sodium hyaluronate, cardiospermum halicacabum flower/leaf/vine extract, rosmarinus officinalis leaf extract, tocopherol, sodium polyacrylate, parfum, phenoxyethanol, ethylhexylglycerin. *I used my phone to scan the ingredients from the tube. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW! Professional Quality!
content: Wow! I never felt so compelled to rush to draft a review! I’m a licensed master aesthetician, 15 years in the professional beauty industry, and have been a certified Body Sugaring Practitioner for 8 years. I have experience with the top professional sugaring companies in this industry. I have to say, I was in a pinch and my order didn’t come in on time. I run a very busy medical aesthetics practice and have a slew of sugaring appointments this week. Regretfully, I took to Amazon prime. Most aestheticians especially Master/Medical Aestheticians are hardcore product snobs, because we only what the best, most  authentic, and highly performing ingredients in everything we use. Efficacy and how products react with the skin is everything to us. I looked over the ingredients here, looked at the way the product looked in the container, and it seemed this one, out of many others, seemed like the closest to what I use and would be delivered quickly, and would get me through my appointments. Boy, was I in for a pleasant surprise! I needed one for Brazilians and one for full leg services. So I purchased the Ultima and Ultra. I was looking for something equivalent to a firm and a soft. The sugaring paste came packed EXTREMELY professionally! The container the label the business cards EVERYTHING was extremely professional! Quite elegant I must add. I blended it with the bit of my other sugaring paste just in case I was disappointed. I did use my sugar paste warmer to bring it to the appropriate temperature and wow! Absolutely fabulous results! Just as good as my Tamera’s Sugaring Paste. For the pros wondering about this: I don’t think any sugaring paste can compare to Alexandria Professional’s , but if you’ve ever used Tamara’s Sugaring paste I’d say this sugaring paste is in a class of its own as well, but is definitely more comparable to Tamara’s. The Ultima is a true firm. The Ultra works more like a medium soft. Kinda wish I’d ordered the Gentle because I like soft sugar for the legs and I use the ancient technique. I don’t use this as a form of waxing so I don’t use any strips but I was worried the Gentle would work like Alexandria professional’s Kiss, which is a thinner sugar for people who use sugaring paste in place of soft wax. After using the Ultra, I think I will purchase the Gentle. I’m very excited about this product line. I’m surprised to see a product like this on Amazon because this isn’t for the general public, as one can gather by reading through the reviews (also just my opinion). This product is high quality and hands down a professional item for licensed Aestheticians and Cosmetologists that are trained Body Sugaring Practitioners. Otherwise, you wouldn’t know exactly how to maneuver this or would have bruises. Or you’d try to use this like it’s wax. It’s definitely not! Definitely am an instant fan, and will be reordering more. THANKS SUGARING FACTORY! Your products and packaging, even the way the product was packaged for delivery was exceptional. Love your vibe! title: 5.0 out of 5 stars High quality and excellent value.
content: Let me begin by pointing out a flaw that I've noticed with many loofah reviews here on Amazon. There seems to be this misconception that loofahs are meant to last forever and reviewers have been quick to rate them poorly if one falls apart before a year. With daily or semi-daily use, most loofahs aren't designed to last more than 3 months at most. Regardless of whether or not your loofah is still in good condition past that threshold you should still be replacing them around 2-3 months due to bacterial growth. Regardless of soap or body wash, mesh and foam still harbor bacteria and eventually it'll get to the point where you are bathing in your own filth. That is why you usually see shower loofahs sold as multi-packs. Now for the product review. These loofahs are some of the best that I've found thus far on Amazon! They are high quality and have a soft, silky texture that makes your showers feel a little more luxurious. The colors look great and should be able to match your bathroom decor without any issue (if you're concerned about that sort of thing). The first loofah from the pack lasted a full month and still looked nice. It broke down minimally and could have lasted another few weeks before it started to look bad, but I chose to start a new one. They all come in a frosted white carrying back with a drawstring at the top and everything was odorless. I mention this because I've had loofahs delivered in the past that arrived with strong plasticy, chemical-like smells. Honestly, you would be hard-pressed to find a higher quality loofah here on Amazon for the price. Once I've used them all up, I plan on purchasing these again in the future :). Read more

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars The best one I tried so far
content: Like so many others, I was looking for a device that would help with some sagging skin and jaw sculpting. I tried a few different models. I wanted to know why some were $80 and others under $30. All have the lights right? Well, let me tell you there is a difference in quality. One unit I had to replace two times, not sure I am allowed to say the name but it's advertised all over social media for around $60. Amazon had the same unit for less money. This unit also had the micro-current option. I already own the Nu-Face which I love to use, but hate to use that sticky gel. I wanted an all-in-one that I could just use my skin cream. Ok, back to the first unit, it lasted one day and died. So I exchanged it, that one lasted 3 days and died. I ordered another unit, "black/gold" for around $80 and it felt great using it. But after 30 days of use, I saw no change at all so I returned it. I will be leaving reviews on those other units if you care to read them. Now about "this unit", so far I think this one is the best. As long as you are not expecting miracles. I see the mixed reviews and I will say how much of a change you see will depend on the person using it. If you are young with firm skin, yes this will improve the appearance of your skin. Maybe even tighten a bit. If you are older with very saggy skin, do not expect this to be your facelift. It may help firm just a bit if you are using very good firming skin care with the unit. Full disclosure, I am 67 and have always taken care of my skin. Even at my age, I do not have any wrinkles, mostly due to the skincare I used for years. However, gravity had to show up. I have some sagging at the jowls and jawline. No turkey neck yet and I hope this device will prevent that. What has this device done so far? After using it every day for 6 weeks, I can now go without makeup. I am constantly getting compliments on my skin and people always seem to think I am 15 years younger than my actual age. Is it due to this device alone? No, it's due to good genes and my skincare that I started in my 30's. I will say this device has made my skin glow, look smoother, and healthier. I use it along with different products that I alternate with. One product has retinol, another has skin-firming properties, another has Vit-C and then there are the moisturizers. One for day and one at night to go over the retinol serum. This device is so easy to use. I love using this while watching TV. It feels great, like a face massage. The blue light is cooling while the green and red light provide just the right amount of warmth. The massage works on all three colors. I can use this device for about 4 or 5 days before charging again. I do use all 3 color lights. It has a timer built in that beeps when you should move on to the next section. I normally do each color two times over each section of my face, jaw, and neck. It has helped with the jawline, but not like they show in the picture, but maybe in time. Again, if I were in my 30's maybe it would sculpt a jawline. I have hopes even at my age. I feel that this device will complement whatever skin care you are using. I think the warmth of the massage helps to get that skin creme into the skin. Give this unit a try but use it with at least a good moisturizer. Be diligent, use it every day for the month. Take before and after pictures. Amazon has a great return policy, even if it does not sculpt the way you want, your skin will still have a healthy glow. Read more
